user.biography: Independent craft brewery in Portland, Maine. Belgian-inspired beers. Certified B Corp. All things beer, food, and Maine. Must be 21+ to follow.

node.text: This week Zach, our Quality Manager, helps to answer two of your questions: can you age saison and wild beers; and what is the best glassware for a lager beer? Have a beer question of your own? Let us know and we may feature it on Quality Time with Allagash.

node.title: Quality Time with Allagash - Aging saison and lager beer glassware

node.text: If you want to know what's going on behind the scenes at Allagash right now, Jill, our Tasting Room's senior manager, sat down with @cheersfrommaine to run through it all.

node.text:
Want to enjoy a perfect glass of Allagash White in the comfort of your own home? Mike is here to show you how to properly "rouse your yeast" for the optimal experience with our favorite witbier.

Have other beer-related questions? Let us know!

node.text: Feel that? Us too. Temperatures in Maine are dropping which means Coolship brewing begins! To help you (and us!) get all geared up for the 2019 Coolship season, check out this incredible video our friend @grassowhat created.

node.text: Truepenny: one both trusty and honest. Also: a crisp and clear pilsner blended with a hint of wild beer. This Belgian-style Pilsner ships to our entire distribution.

node.text: Celebrating National Oyster Day with our friends at Maine Oyster Company.

node.title: Oyster Week at Maine Oyster Company

node.text: We join Mike at Eventide Oyster Company to tell us a little bit about how to get started with briny bivalves.

node.text:
You don’t need to be on a river trip to enjoy a River Trip, but it sure doesn’t hurt.

📸 @tightloopsfly with @maineflycompany

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of drink.

node.text: Care to join us in sharing an Allagash White this weekend?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of 1 person, food and indoor.

node.text: In celebration of oyster day (today!), we’ve decided to wax poetic about one of our favorite pairings: oysters and beer. it goes without saying that you can never go wrong by pairing Allagash White with shellfish, with its citrusy spice cutting right through the richness of the sweet oyster meat. Likewise, the grapefruit-forward hop notes of River Trip, along with its addition of coriander, juxtaposes beautifully with their sharp, salty tang. Here in Maine, we're lucky to have some of the tastiest oysters we've encountered. Got a favorite beer and oyster combo? Let’s hear it!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of drink.

node.text: Now there are three ways to find your Little Grove. Introducing Little Grove Apples & Cranberry, the third in our series of lightly fruited beers. We brew this one with cranberries and blend in the juice of freshly pressed apples for a deliciously dry apple flavor and an effervescent cranberry zing. The kicker? Every can in our Little Grove series clocks in at 100 calories and 4.0% ABV or less. Look out for it in the next few weeks at a store near you, wherever Allagash is sold.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of drink and outdoors.

node.text: Crisp and golden with notes of honey, tropical hops, citrus, and a hint of malt. That’s Sixteen Counties, brewed with 100% Maine-grown grain to celebrate the bounty of our home state. It's only available here in Maine, so we'd love to share one with you next time you’re in our neck of the woods.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 02, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text: There’s no getting around it: We love blueberries. So you can imagine how excited we are to see a fresh crop drop on our doorstep this week, the first of about 2.6k pounds of them we’ll see this year. We use Maine wild lowbush varieties to lend a slightly tart and tannic quality to quite a few of our beers, including Little Sal, Pick Your Own, and a new wild ale we expect to tell you more about later this fall. These babies come to us via Tavern Hill Farm over in Windham, and we’d like to take this moment to thank them for making our day.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 02, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 02, 2021. May be an image of nature.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 02, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 02, 2021. May be a closeup of nature.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company on August 02, 2021. May be an image of food.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Maine. May be an image of tree and nature.

node.text: No cell service. Dirt roads. And truly beautiful nature. Would you visit Maine’s 100-Mile Wilderness?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of drink, indoor and text that says 'ALLAGASH GASH COOLS cerise spontaneously ALLAGASH BREWING'.

node.text: This cherry beer was years in the making. Now, it’s heading your way. Coolship Cerise, our spontaneously fermented ale, ferments for up to two years in oak wine barrels, followed by a lengthy rest on Maine-grown Montmorency and Balaton cherries. Our patience was rewarded with a tart, dry profile, rounded out by notes of fresh-picked cherry, pie spice, oak, and a hint of apricot. And it’s starting to ship out nearly everywhere our beer is sold. Find it in CT, DC, DE, GA, Chicagoland, MA, MD, ME, NC, NH, NJ, NY, RI, SC, VA, WI, and VT.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Maine. May be an image of child and grass.
Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of drink.

node.text:
Think of this as life handing you lemons. From Maine, With Love 07 is a crisp beer brewed with lemon and sea salt, fermented with our saison yeast strain. A little tart, a little tropical, a whole lotta refreshment.

Starting tomorrow (7/29) you’ll only be able to find From Maine, With Love 07 releasing in our tasting room. Our From Maine, With Love series offers first-ever tastes of new Allagash beer. Ideas for this innovative line of beers can come from any employee at our brewery. And a portion of the proceeds from all From Maine, With Love beers goes to preserving and protecting Casco Bay in Portland, Maine.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Allagash Brewing Company. May be an image of indoor.

node.text: Freshly bottled and heading your way.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Allagash Brewing Company in Portland, Maine. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: An oyster in hand is worth two in the sea. Especially when you have a Tripel in the other hand. Then it’s probably worth three sea oysters.
